title: What’s the difference between steps, stairs, staircase, and stairwell? - Quora

response.answer_text: The terms all refer to either individual components, or everything as a whole. Steps are the individual platforms (comprising a tread and a riser) on which a user will place their feet.Stairs usually refers to a group of steps, known as a “flight”A staircase would describe all the components collectively including flights of steps, landings and balustrades.A stairwell is void space in a building in which a staircase is positioned.Linguistically the terms are often used interchangeably. For example a person might say they wish to “take the stairs” or instruct another to “follow the steps down” both expressions mean the same thing conversationally speaking.

I would not take myself as a specialist in language, any one. But: Steps are something you clime on, or stepping rise or decline e.g. the sitting platforms in auditorium are referred as stepping, it also referred to horizontal elements in ladder, also horizontal part of the stairs.Stairs are referred to what you step on to get to the next level.Staircase is the combination of the stairs that are taking you to next level.Stairwell is the structure that contains staircase that contains stairs that contain steps.😊
